citations.excerpt:
Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements. This includes:
- Access control policy covering all types of access
- Rights of access based on need-to-use principle
- Procedures for granting, reviewing, and revoking access rights
- Documentation of access rights for each user and asset
- Regular review of access rights (at least annually)
- Removal of access...

metadata.summary:
Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets shall be established and implemented based on business and information security requirements. This includes:
- Access control policy covering all types of access
- Rights of access based on need-to-use principle
- Procedures for granting, reviewing, and revoking access rights
- Documentation of access rights for each user and asset
- Regular review of access rights (at least annually)
- Removal of access rights when employment/contract terminates

citations.excerpt:
The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events to meet the entity's objectives. This includes:
- Identifying and authenticating users
- Considering network segmentation
- Managing the identification, authentication, and authorization process
- Managing privileged access credentials and removing access when no longer authorized

metadata.summary:
The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events to meet the entity's objectives. This includes:
- Identifying and authenticating users
- Considering network segmentation
- Managing the identification, authentication, and authorization process
- Managing privileged access credentials and removing access when no longer authorized

citations.excerpt:
Organizations must:
- Employ the principle of least privilege for system access
- Authorize access to security functions and security-relevant information only
- Grant users (or processes acting on behalf of users) only the minimum privileges necessary
- Implement least privilege for specific duties and information systems
- Review user privileges periodically and adjust as needed
